hikes.author: Megan
hikes.shortDescription: Difficult hike with a beautiful view at the top
hikes.description: The Dog Mountain Trail climbs 2,820 feet in just 3 miles — a butt-kicking ascent — to a summit of 2,970 feet. Wildflower meadows are the highlight at the top.
hikes.notes: Some say that this is a busy trail but there was alomost no one hiking when I went in June.
hikes.recommendation: Don't forget to bring cash for parking!

hikes.author: Nina
hikes.shortDescription: Short hike with waterfall at the end
hikes.description: This hike is very short (1 mile roundtrip) but does take some time to do. The trail leads down from the road into a stream bed. You follow the stream bed upstream through a narrow gorge. At the entrance to the gorge there is a large log jam. This requires some balance to climb over; be very careful if it is wet.
hikes.notes: This hike has become extremely overcrowded during the summer.
hikes.recommendation: If going in the busy season go earlier because parking becomes a challenge. If you are bringing your dog be sure that they are capable of clibming over slippery logs.

hikes.author: Steve
hikes.shortDescription: Old abandoned railroad tracks and spooky tunnels.
hikes.description: If you are craving adventure and exploration in a unique hiking setting, then you have come to the right place! This is a hike where every time you turn a corner your eyes light up with excitement and your imagination runs wild. Be forewarned though…if you fear cold, dark, and creepy abandoned train tunnels, this hike is not for you. If you fear extreme heights over abandoned train trestles, this hike is not for you.
hikes.notes: Some say that this is a busy trail but there was alomost no one hiking when I went in June.
hikes.recommendation: Don't do this hike if scared of heights!
